p: In addition to the chemopreventive, sedative and antimicrobial activity xanthohumol also exhibits anti-inflammatory properties. At least a portion of this action originates in its ability to influence the IKK activity whether through the inhibition of TNF-induced IKK activation or through the suppression of the nuclear translocation of NF-ÎºB by direct interaction with cysteine residues of IKK [ 99].
